quotes.quote: We only know of one duty, and that is to love.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: It is the duty of every citizen according to his best capacities to give validity to his convictions in political affairs.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The first duty of a leader is to make himself be loved without courting love. To be loved without 'playing up' to anyone - even to himself.
quotes.author: Andre Malraux

quotes.quote: I came to realize that life lived to help others is the only one that matters and that it is my duty...This is my highest and best use as a human.
quotes.author: Ben Stein

quotes.quote: A sense of duty is useful in work, but offensive in personal relations. People wish to be liked, not be endured with patient resignation.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: The first duty of a man is the seeking after and the investigation of truth.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: There are some duties we owe even to those who have wronged us. There is, after all, a limit to retribution and punishment.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: There is no duty more obligatory than the repayment of kindness.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: There is no such thing as luck. It's a fancy name for being always at our duty, and so sure to be ready when good time comes.
quotes.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quotes.quote: Majesty: when a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of, he always declares it as his duty.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: When a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of, he always declares that it is his duty.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: The reward of one duty is the power to fulfill another.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: The paths of glory at least lead to the grave, but the paths of duty may not get you any where.
quotes.author: James Thurber

quotes.quote: The strongest is never strong enough to be always the master, unless he transforms strength into right, and obedience into duty.
quotes.author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

quotes.quote: How can you come to know yourself? Never by thinking, always by doing. Try to do your duty, and you'll know right away what you amount to.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Duty is ours, results are God's.
quotes.author: John Quincy Adams

quotes.quote: Life is not so important as the duties of life.
quotes.author: John Randolph

quotes.quote: A duty dodged is like a debt unpaid; it is only deferred, and we must come back and settle the account at last.
quotes.author: Joseph F. Newton

quotes.quote: When you have a number of disagreeable duties to perform, always do the most disagreeable first.
quotes.author: Josiah Quincy

quotes.quote: I take it as a man's duty to restrain himself.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: The dead cannot cry out for justice; it is a duty of the living to do so for them.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.quote: We have no eternal allies, and we have no perpetual enemies. Our interests are eternal and perpetual, and those interests it is our duty to follow.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Do something every day that you don't want to do; this is the golden rule for acquiring the habit of doing your duty without pain.
quotes.author: Paul Tillich

quotes.quote: The first duty of love is to listen.
quotes.author: Robert E. Lee

quotes.quote: Duty then is the sublimest word in the English language. You should do your duty in all things. You can never do more, you should never wish to do less.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.quote: There is no duty we so much underrate as the as the duty of being happy.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.quote: There is no duty we so much underrate as the duty of being happy.
quotes.author: Thomas Brummond

quotes.quote: Be eager to fulfill the smallest duty and flee from transgression for one duty includes another and one transgression induces another transgression.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.quote: Property has its duties as well as its rights.
He that would make his own liberty secure, must guard even his enemy from oppression; for if he violates this duty, he establishes a precedent that will reach to himself.
